description: They have the best lunch pizza deal I've seen in SF.. I highly reccomend coming here!
author: Jared R.

description:
The pizza is ok, not good food quality 
Cheep cheese
Cheep pizza sauce 
Won't buy again
author: Margarita L.

description:
customer service is okay, pizza tastes really good but downfall is its very, very,thin and slice is flimsy when you take a bite!
when i was ordering using a coupon for a n extra large pizza two toppings, i tried to add two extra toppings that i would pay for and tgey said no i couldn't do that! which was disappointing, because af every other pizza place i have been able to do it!!!
so, overall it"s not my favorite!!!!!
author: Susie C.

description:
We ordered a 1/2 cheese 1/2 veggie lovers, and the overall pizza quality was decent. I suspect the meat-based pies are probably a lot better. BUT they got to our house in RECORD time (quoted 45 minutes delivery, arrived in maybe 15?). Amazing. 

Lots of interesting combos available on their menu to try. We will definitely order here again.
author: K. C.

description: I ordered a small cheese pizza. It was pretty decent, certainly not the best cheese pizza I've had, and nothing to remember really..
author: Shruti D.

description:
I am posting this review about a year or so late, but I think my story needs to be shared.

I ordered using their online ordering service off the website and never received the food.  

When we called to see where our order was we were told that it had never been received and to contact the company they use for the ordering service.  

Unable to get a response from the ordering service (it was around midnight), I checked my credit card and saw that the charge was processing from Bernal Heights Pizzeria.

We called them back asking if we can please have the order we were charged for we were told that it was not their problem and there was nothing they would do about it.  Since it didn't show on their computer they refused to honor the order.

I then had to go through the process of waiting for the charge to finish processing on my card (it did, and yes it went through) and challenge a $50 food delivery order through the credit card company.
author: Liz Z.

description: Ok... (deep breath) I custom ordered an XL pizza for delivery which ended up being $50, fine. The pizza is delicious, there's no arguing that which is why I've ordered from them before. Here's the issue: a $50 pizza comes without crushed red pepper, parmesan cheese, napkins, or plates; just the pizza. I called the place immediately to voice my concern, but didn't seem to get anywhere with the woman I spoke to. She made zero effort to try and rectify the situation, showed no sympathy, blamed me for not requesting any crushed bell peppers or parmesan cheese, and then said "our customers know the pizza doesn't come with any of that." I politely asked to speak with a manager to which she responded "I am the manager." This isn't the first time I've had someone from there argue with me. Last time, I tried to point out to the person on the phone that their online ordering system gives a different price than the price over the phone to which they responded "hm, that's weird." The time before that I had to explain to them that an American Express card has a four-digit code, not three because the gentleman I spoke with on the phone kept insisting I was giving him the wrong security code for my card. Customer service goes a long way, regardless of how good a product may be. Don't plan on ordering from here ever again, which is a shame because it is good pizza.
author: Mo S.

description:
Its hard to satisfy your major pizza craves when you imagine what the heights special pizza will look like :)  and when it arrives :/ and then when u eat it 
 :( . 3stars for heights special. Friendly delivery guy. Accurate ETA.
author: Doby H.

description: Pizza was okay.  Nothing special.  Delivery service was earlier than expected which is great.
author: Melissa H.

description: Solid. Consistent. My go-to pizza place in or near Bernal Heights. Also, delivery comes a bit faster than they commit to! Kudos!
author: Mike U.

description: Had small SF supreme pizza...it was really good. Even my grandmother liked it and she can be a bit of a good critic. We watched some FIFA and had a nice convo with the server. Not too far from my house. Will return again.
author: Lisette B.

description: I love the pizza here!! They finally came back after closing for a few months. Their pizza and food is back and better than ever. The people at Bernal are so nice and friendly and their food complements the place even more now!! I recommend their SF supreme for those who like meat and veggies in their pizza. I feel like it is one of there greatest ones the have.
author: Jose D.

description:
Finally, a delicious, reasonably priced pizzeria in San Francisco!  A buddy and I stumbled upon this place late Friday night, and I'm happy to say this small pizzeria earned FIVE STARS on all levels!
Based on the reviews I've read, I think this place must have made some positive changes recently because we were seriously blown away by the food, service and the overall atmosphere of this restaurant.  Marco was our server and also worked at the counter/register.  You know a server is outstanding, when he is upbeat, positive and smiling at the end of a late Friday night work shift!  This nice gentleman really knew the menu, and made some outstanding suggestions.  We ordered the cheesy garlic bread as an appetizer and were very impressed!  Perfectly baked, with quality ingredients (not low grade, rubbery cheese and that oily imitation melted butter stuff other pizzeria's use).  This cheesy garlic bread melted in my mouth!  For our pizza order, we decided to go with monster slices.  I couldn't believe it, these monster slices start at only $3.50 (toppings and premium combinations are a bit extra).  Our monster slices arrived promptly, and they actually consisted of THREE regular pizza slices in one huge slice (they even slice it in three sections for you, so it is easier to eat).  I found the monster slice to be the perfect size, for one person as I usually only eat two or three regular slices of pizza at a time.  The pizza was baked to perfection, with a mouth watering, "buttery" crust, perfectly seasoned pizza sauce and a fresh combination of premium cheeses that really sets this establishment apart from the competition!  
We also appreciated the friendly SF "neighborhood" vibe in the dining area.  It wasn't too crowded or loud, and had a very warm, inviting atmosphere.  I can't tell you how many times I've visited North Beach pizza places here in SF that leave their doors wide open, so you freeze, dining under harsh florescent lighting among shouting customers and pan handlers begging at your table.  We were so happy to find such an amazing and delicious alternative!
author: R.J. S.

description: A bit of confusion with the name change there, but this is still the super legit pies I remember since moving here. If you're searching for pizza online and this joint shows up near you - this is the one. Dynamite pizza and quick delivery.
author: Micah B.

description: Worst pizza I've had in a long time. Disappointing because it's so near my house and every other place I've tried in the neighborhood is excellent.
author: Spencer B.

description: We are from out of town and I was craving pizza but did not want any type of hip gourmet pizza. After much searching we landed here and we were not disappointed. Sauce has a great taste and it was cooked perfectly. Even my 3 year old gobbled it up. She really loved the pepperoni.
author: Heather M.

description: Thin style pizza very tasty. The crust was delicious! Delivery was super quicks!  We will b definitely ordering again
author: Ramie S.

description: Bernal heights pizzaria is one of the best pizzas in town I eat here every time I can because of the amazing costumer service to the clean environment and lets not forget the good pizza
author: Eduardo S.

description:
THE WORST. 

I ordered a pizza which never showed up. TWO HOURS LATER I finally called to ask what was going on and the woman on the phone yelled at me and insisted it had already been delivered (WRONG!). Finally she figured out that it had been forgotten in the kitchen. She then promised me it was going to be delivered within 10 minutes. ONE HOUR LATER still nothing had showed up. I called again, no answer. Finally I had to call GrubHub to get a refund (they were horrified) three hours after I placed the order.

I ended up having to make dinner for my daughter which defeated the entire purpose of having a pizza night. I'm literally 40 weeks pregnant and exhausted and this place really screwed up my evening of not having to cook and wasted three hours of my life keeping me waiting. My daughter ended up going to bed late because I kept promising her the pizza was coming and finally had to make her something else.

No apologies, refunds or anything were offered by the restaurant. Horrible customer service and a poorly run establishment. As a San Francisco business owner myself, I cannot fathom how someone allows this kind of thing to occur. 

Don't bother ordering from this place. I certainly never will again.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
Very good place to eat,  yummy yummy 
5 stars , always good , no regrets ever,  really really good . 
Totally recommend .
Place is always clean and organized. 
People are great to attend. 
I love the Hawaiian one with chicken , yummy yummy 
Thanks guys .
author: Debora D.

description: Surprisingly good street pizza, crispy crust (a little on the light side, but very tasty). Quick delivery. A keeper.
author: David K.

description: Being type 2 diabetic I shy away from carbs, so pizza isn't an option. I ordered buffalo wings & they were terrific. On the other hand my husband had a sausage & pepperoni pizza and his opinion was that it was "slightly better than Domino's or Pizza Hut."
author: Lawrence G.

description:
Thin, crispy, delicious. Was still hot on arrival.  Toppings are fresh and tasty.

FYI - Just checked the SF Health Inspection database.  They have never received any score less than a 91.  
https://101g-xnet.sfdph.org:8443/ords/f?p=132:2:::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:87802
author: Daniel G.

description:
Whew!  The Monster Slice of Cheese was only $3.50.
It was big enough for two people.
I've had better pizza but not at this price--it's a good deal.
Next time I'll add a topping for more taste.
author: Thomas D.

description: The pizza is really good and crunchy. I have been to other places and the pizza always comes out soggy. I recommended it and think that y'all will enjoy sitting in that quiet atmosphere enjoying a delicious slice. Their tap beers are also some of the best quality drinks I had in a while. And the young servers are always so nice and attentive and will accommodate anything in have menu to your tastes.
author: Chapinsito F.

description: Was the only one there, they burned the one slice of pizza I ordered; waited half hour for it. First and last time I eat there.
author: Peter G.

description: I am so happy Bernal Heights is back! This pizza is the best! I love Mr. Bernal. Its my favorite pizza. THe pizza crust is incredible, every pizza you get is awesome no matter what topping. Great ambiance and great customer service.
author: Marina Z.

description: Solid pie and very nicely cooked crust. You can tell they have extremely high heat ovens as they get a nice crispy yet chewing crust that's borderline perfect. Delivery was quick and sides were nice quality. Taking down a notch because pizza box was very flimsy and almost buckled when holding on one side. Thankfully averted disaster.
author: Robert R.

description:
Just got a plain cheese, thin crust pie delivered.  It's as if they listened to my original review 3 years ago.  Now, on my second try (I'm from out of town)... they really upped their game!  The force is strong with this one.
Great balance of cheese/sauce/crust; nice, subtle zing on the sauce; good, thin crust (I put a few slices straight from the box to the toaster and it worked a treat... cardboard comes from the darkside.
author: Josh K.

description:
I just read a response from the mgr  Meghan. 


Lies   perhaps you should look to your staff and question who are truthful. Lying to safe face lying to save their jobs. 

Treating the customers the way you have treated me.......Im surprised you're not closed yet.

but lets see what I can do about that since now you've gone ahead and insulted me instead of fixing the problem.

I was ALSO ALERTED BY YELP THAT THE RECENT HEALTH INSPECTION FOR FOOD WAS IN THE BOTTOM 5%

GIAN N.'s review is a total and absolute fabrication  he is a Freind of the mgr who hung up on me
author: Michael M.

description:
Nasty / fools 

They couldn't made me vegetarian pizza so I had to get pepperoni it was nasty and on top of that my husband left tips when I told him not to because they didn't deserve it . Please go somewhere else where they know what they are doing . Not from fools like this .
author: Nena A.

description:
Disappointed in the service, food was average, pricing on the high side for non-artisan pizza.

Called in a simple order for pickup, was told 25min prep time. Showed up 5 min early, paid for food, but was told it would be anther 5-10min. After waiting another 20min+, our food was finally ready for takeout. 

Total was $45 for 1 pizza, 1 calzone that my girlfriend and I shared. Seemed overpriced for mediocre quality food. No apologies for the poor service and extra waiting time. Pizza by the slice may be a better deal here.
author: Kieran G.

description: Very friendly and attentive. I stopped in for a glass of wine only but they were lovely to me and their pizza looked really good. A neighborhood place without pomp and circumstance but plenty of hospitality! They also do a healthy takeout business and seemed to have tons of regulars - always a good sign.
author: Karen B.

description:
I like their pizza when they get it right.  My favorite is the Chicken Bacon Ranch and add feta, tomatoes, and olives.
Problem is...
MANY times they don't get it right.
I ordered this and it arrived 45 minutes later, wrong.
I called them and they came back and only retrieved the wrong one.
They had to make a THIRD trip to deliver what I ordered.
They do offer discounts for the next one.  Believe me, I've had to use the discounts a few times.  I only keep using them because, like I wrote, the food is good.  (My sister usually has just one piece of pizza and ate nearly three pieces of the one I described above)
They are right on the 36 bus line, so I may have to only do pick-up to make sure I get what I've ordered.
author: Rebecca K.

description: Had a yummy  pizza and salad dinner here on a Thursday night (not very busy for dine in and we were seated right away). It looks like they just remodeled and it was nice and very clean inside. Our server was great--quick, friendly, and attentive. Glad we have now found a go to pizza spot for a quick meal in the neighborhood.
author: Natalia K.

description:
Not a yelper never have been but after this experience I had to do it.
Ordered a bacon cheese burger and fries.
1 It came with bacon missing
2 The Burger was cold
3 The fries were cold and hard as concrete
No joy after calling them
Cannot believe that people actually think this place is any good
Its a disgrace to the restaurant/pizza community in San Francisco
If zeros stars were an option that's what it would have got
author: John R.

description: Used to order this place a lot, but I dunno if they hired someone new or what happened but they've made big mistakes (missing items) with our delivery order 3 times in a row!  We're done ordering from them, sorry to say.
author: Tim B.

description: Paid $38 for XL pizza delivered 1 hr & 10 minutes very cold in poor condition.i should not have accepted it, trying to be polite I did & I feel I allow this place to rob me. Please avoid this place it is not worth it.. should not get any star, but would not allow me to post... Avoid!
author: Love C.

description: Great people great food great environment. Brazilian appertizers are a must have. The staff is friendly and costumer service is great. Pizzas are exceptional. Have been coming here for a while and will keep coming back. 5 stars well deserved
author: Bruna G.

description:
Ordered from here on eat24.

Had high hopes for their thin crust pizza. I ordered the Greek pizza. The toppings were fresh and yummy, but the crust was thin and chewy......like yoga-mat-chewy:(

Disappointing.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
We ordered delivery from here earlier this month and were pleasantly surprised.  There was no obvious way to order 1/2 and 1/2 combo pizza so we called them and they were super polite. They changed our order to exactly what we needed without a single issue.

It arrived hot and still crisp, not a bad start.  I had the meat lovers and it was like a meat orgy in my mouth, really delicious and somehow didn't overpower the rest of the pizza.  My wife had the veggie and she enjoyed it as well.

We will order from here again, it's rare to get good thin crust via delivery.
author: Saminda W.

description: Went here for a local community fundraiser and was I impressed. The food is good, lots of selection's, beer and wine menu was good as well but the customer service was by far the best. Very polite and attentive. A+ and they have Tv's. The waiting period was not long at all even though they were packed. I will be going there again for sure...
author: J B.

description: I have nothing but good things to say great service friendly employees food is great I definitely recommend the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken that is definitely my favorite ,but everything else is also wonderful they have a really good collection of wine I would definitely recommend this place to any of my friends.
author: Beatriz S.

description: We ordered the deluxe veggie and added chicken to it and it was DELICIOUS!!! Awesome crust and generous toppings. Ordered an app of mozzarella sticks, which were amazing when dipped in the marinara sauce (not a typical marinara by the way, but with chunks of tomato and just pure yumminess). We will definitely be going back for this pizza and to try more things!!!
author: Jenn G.

description: Came to meet my buddy for a beer and a slice. Great food and service! Really nice wine selection and the SF supreme pizza was amazing!
author: Ian N.

description:
We stumbled across this place tonight and boy are we glad we did. We saw the gluten free available in the window, so that's what brought us in. Very warm and inviting place. Our server Martin (pronounced Marteen) made the experience the 5 star rating! He was so, kind, attentive and personable, his service was impeccable! 
Now, my daughter and I need to eat gluten free because of our food allergies so we ordered the gluten free pizza crust with sausage, pepperoni and olives. My husband ordered the same but had just a large slice of the regular crust. Unfortunately, if you want gluten free you have to order the whole pizza and it only comes in medium. Sometimes mediums can be small, but not here, their medium is a nice size! It was so delicious!!! Very thin crust which we like, the sausage was delicious and looked homemade, not like some sausage that looks like rabbit pellets. My daughter and I both loved it! My husband said his was good too. He also had a glass of Cabernet and it was a nice full glass. Martin asked him if he would like a piece of Tiramisu for dessert. He said no thanks but Martin explained it was the last piece and it would just get thrown out, so he said it's free. My husband decided to try it, he said it was really good. At the end, when we got our check, Martin had written a little story on the back of our receipt that was really sweet! We will definitely be coming back because the pizza was good, but mostly because Martin's service is worth coming back for!
author: Stacey R.

description: This place rules. One of the hardest things about moving back to the West (aka Best) Coast was the lack of decent pizza options. And while Bernal Heights Pizza is not the fanciest place to grab pizza in the city, they make some great pies. Go for the Dolores: it's the best!!
author: M G.

description:
Ordered here via GrubHub.  Sent the wrong pizza.  Delivery man didn't know and didn't speak English, so he took the pizza (left the rest of the order - wings/salad).

Returned an HOUR later with the SAME pizza.  Seems I ordered margherita pizza with mushroom & pepperoni, got sliced tomatoes and basil.  I called to complain and the manager was an ASS.  Very loud.  Very rude.  All I got was "call Grubhub!"  

Apparently, the margherita pizza IS the one with the tomatoes on top, but still NO pepperoni.  NO mushroom.  NO explanation.  NO English.  NO apology.  Didn't care when I told him my kids didn't eat.  Took an HOUR and FIVE minutes to bring back the SAME pizza.

Also, ranch and bleu cheese are both white, but they're different things.

Food 2 stars
Customer Service 0 stars
average..  1 star.
author: Eric F.

description:
Family friendly and the food is delicious!!
Excellent service. The restaurant was so busy, but our waitress was amazing in checking in. We felt very welcomed here!
author: Evi K.

description: Very solid pizza. Toppings were fresh, sauce was tangy, and there was just the right amount of cheese. The crust was the weakest link, seemed like it was pre-rolled and/or frozen. The pizza was delivered hot and in less than an hour! We were very pleased. Large pizza is more than enough for three people. We'll order again.
author: Christiana G.

description: As a San Francisco native I find this place really disgusting, it doesn't feel like home at all. When the cashier served us to-go she said her name was Paola. She was always smiling but I had trouble understanding her because her accent. The floor was super disgusting, not only that but the health score they have up is a 98% which is from OVER 2 YEARS AGO. Strike three was definitely the constantly going outside to smoke a cigarette. When she came back inside she didn't even wash her hands. How does the owner not realize this? Bernal heights you need to step your game up. No wonder this place is always empty! I will never ever be going back nor recommend this place to anyone. YUCKKKKKKK
author: Sheryn P.

description: We just stopped in. We ordered linguine with red sauce. They gave us squishy fettuccine with with white cream sauce. Took so long we were late and us 3 vegans dropped it in the bin.
author: Christian N.

description:
I moved from the Midwest to SF two years ago. After trying every pizza place in my delivery range, I was beginning to think I would never find a real slice of pizza. I don't care if your pizza is organic, or if the pepperoni was made from a pig who smiled a lot. If the pizza was good, you wouldn't need a gimmick.

Today I was blown away by the new guys in town! First off, I was quoted a 45-60 wait and the doorbell rang 30 minutes later. Yeah the doorbell, not my cellphone ringing with a snotty teenager on then line telling me he's parked outside. Standing at my door, was the most polite delivery driver I have met. After saying thanks, I carried the food up stairs and opened the box to epic family fanfare. On first bite, a smile crept upon my face and my eyes blissfully closed. I felt at home again. 

Thank you Bernal Heights Pizzaria. You made my night... a customer for life.
author: Chase L.

description: Our go-to spot when you want great pizza delivered!  The supreme pizza is a favorite.  They also have gluten-free options which is def a plus!!!
author: Clyde L.

description:
The service is amazing, Camilla is the sweetest!  She is super honest and explains all your options.  Being a vegetarian, it's sometimes hard to find a place that is good, of not decent that has more than "mushrooms" (I say this because some places used canned or frozen mushrooms- can you believe that?!  *ahem* Pizza Joint).

I digress...regardless if your hankering is a giant plate of spaghetti with meatballs as big as Shaq's fist, or if you want to satiate your craving for dessert AND pizza (because they combine the two- you heeaarrrrd me) this is your place.  With a cheery and well-lit atmosphere and may I add SUPER clean (like OCD clean) you really can't go wrong.  

Oh and one more thing- they do free neighborhood delivery.

Yeah.  You're all set buddy.  For life.  Kick off your shoes and put your stretchy pants on because you're gonna wanna chow down!
author: Jillian K.

description: Woww I love the pizza there. They also have such good wines. The pizza there gives you orgasm. It taste yummy!! And who loves wine  will have such a great time eating and drinking there with friends. It's a very fun and cozy environment.
author: Bruna B.

description: Really nice place. Pizza is decent classic pizzeria fare, which is better than any of the other non-artisanal/hipster pizzerias in the neighborhood can say(there are some really bad ones in this neighborhood). The space is friendly, clean and bright, lots of windows, very pleasant staff, a nice little beer and wine bar for hanging out.
author: jack b.

description:
If you're in Bernal, this is your best pizza option. It's a bit pricier than others, but it's worth it. 

I've had only slices of pizza so far. One cheese ($3) and one 2 topping ($4.50). The ingredients are quality and it's thin crust. 

Will definitely be coming back for more!
author: Carlos M.

description:
I love that they deliver on time! I ordered two pizzas on the phone and they delivered within the 45 minute timeframe they said they would. The meat lovers pizza was delicious, and we also ordered the bernal heights special with quail egg on it. 

My only lament that it cost around $70 for two large pizzas. The pizzas aren't that big. But if you're too drunk to drive somewhere, you can't beat pizza delivery!
author: Mina K.

description:
DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE. We placed an order online over an hour and thirty minutes ago. We got told the order would arrive at 8.08pm. Called at 8:30pm to ask where our order was and was told it was 2 mins away. Called again at 8:45pm to be told that they hadn't noticed the order on the email and that they could send it in 20mins. Absolutely disgusting customer service! The fact that they LIED which delayed the time even more. 

DISHONEST AND THE 2ND TIME THEY HAVE DISAPPOINTED ME! NEVER AGAIN!!!
author: Kelly M.

description: I've never dined in here but have ordered from Eat24 several times. The pizza is always delivered promptly. It's better than most takeout pizza places in SF and they have a lot of different creative varieties.
author: Diana G.

description: Their pizza is amazing. If you go there try the SF Supreme or BBQ chicken pizza. I'm sure you won't regret. Great place to go for a draft beer and appetizer as well!
author: Flávia C.

description: I ordered last Sunday 3 pizza for my family. And I had a very good experience. The pizza was delicious
author: Marcos R.

description:
I was ready to leave a good review just for the excellent service, happily the pizza matched the service.

For whatever reason San Francisco is a wasteland when it comes to good old-fashioned pizza. I'm not talking about artisan pies with locally sourced fennel and arugula. Sometimes I just want a tasty slice with good cheese, good sauce and a quality crust.

Luckily Bernal Heights Pizzeria has arrived to save me from a trip to the East coast the next time I have a craving.

One visit later and I already know I'll become a regular.
author: Mark F.

description:
Was in the Excelsior neighborhood and wanted to order some BBQ chicken pizza.

Apparently their BBQ chicken pizza still calls for tomato sauce and merely adds a light drizzle of BBQ sauce. Unsure if it's how they always do it or they just skimped this time. They also put basil on their BBQ chicken pizza which wasn't horrendous, just unusual.

Pizza was still alright although I wish it clarified that they still use tomato sauce and just drizzle some bbq.

We ordered through Eat24 and order for "ASAP" and they were at the house within about 45 minutes so delivery was quick.
author: Lauren L.

description: The food is good, took a long time to get the food though.  We ate in, and there was just one other couple and took about 45 minutes to get pasta and a sandwich.  I would recommend getting delivery instead!
author: Mandy B.

description: Seriously solid pizza -- probably my favorite in the neighborhood. Some of their specials (like the Dolores or the Heights Special) are especially great, with a crispy thin crust. On top of the the people here are super friendly, and the wait is always reasonable. You really can't go wrong here.
author: J.T. T.

description: Great pizza! Stopped by after seeing the shop while waiting at the light and enjoyed the pizza plus service. Flavian was kind and took care of us! They also have GLUTEN FREE pizza and ACAI BOWLS!
author: ashton n.

description: This is an excellent, friendly neighborhood pizzarella, not a gourmet restaurant. They serve very good pizza, delivered in about 45 minutes. I always order thin crust and the key is to ask for "well done." You can't go wrong with simple toppings like sausage and mushrooms. Always tip the delivery person well.
author: Julie B.

description:
Just moved to the area.. and I am already in LOVE. Great BBQ chicken pizza. I pick up since I live around the corner. I have yet to be disappointed. Additionally, the night cashier stayed past closing to assure we got our pizza that was ordered 5 minutes before closing... SHES a WINNER... :) 

BBQ Wings and Garlic  Fries are also a good one to order..
author: Lei F.

description:
This was for home delivery.

One of my good friends came over and we decided to have something delivered.  But neither of us were in the mood for pizza. I've ordered a couple of times over the past year from BERNAL HEIGHTS PIZZERIA. Their pasta dishes are excellent.

We ordered Cheesy Garlic Bread, and for our mains we had Linguini with Shrimp and the Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo. For dessert we split a Tiramisu.  Everything was great!

Delivery only took 45 min. And ordering was very easy and the employees were friendly.

Definitely recommend.
author: Janet T.

description:
Very tasteful pizza and it didn't make me feel I had eaten too much.... I have eaten pizza every  where in the city..
This place is very cosy, nice and awesome  people.. 
It took just about 15 minutes to have it done... I hadn't earn for 3 hours prior to going there, so I can have as many slices ..
We shared one large pizza within 3 people..
Next time I'm going to try the Bernal Heights special for sure..
This time I created my style..
I don't think you cant go wrong there... 
I'd advise you to save time for parking..
I'll be back:)
author: Pedro D.

description:
Tasty, quick delivery, and customizable.  Color me a fan.

GrubHub quoted an hour and the delivery came in 30 minutes.

Glad to have a pizza that is more topping than dough!  Saturday evening made killer.
author: Sarah C.

description: We use Bernal Heights Pizza about once a month for school events. They are great. always on-time delivery and they cut slices small for us special. tasty.
author: Ericka S.

description: Best pizza ever! Had great service tonight. Delicious food and very attentive service, especially from Flavia, it felt like she was one step ahead of anything we were going to ask for. Will definitely be back. ps. try Mister Bernal pizza and Dolores!
author: Marco A.

description: Ok pizza, inconsistent delivery service. I've received the wrong order before, and tonight, didn't receive my order at all (they blamed it on Grubhub).
author: C. Elizabeth R.

description: We really fell in love with this place after ordering from here a couple of times. In a land of bad attitudes and no customer service skills, Bernal Heights Pizzeria really stands out! I could not believe how great their customer service level was when we ordered. Not to mention, the pizza was also super delish! A few times we have ordered things like the Jalapeno Poppers and they have also been great! The price is pretty impressive for the quality. Every time we have ordered from here, the pizza has arrived ahead of schedule. I really can't say enough about them. It is so nice to have a quality experience for a good price and efficient service where you, as the consumer, get treated with respect. GO HERE!
author: Rachel M.

description:
This review is specifically for delivery:

I am a huge fan of this pizzeria!!  I have ordered from here on multiple occasions.  The pizza is always delicious, the service/driver is always prompt and friendly, and the Caesar salad is on point!  Great selection and always fresh and hot.
author: E Z.

description:
DELICIOUS Pizza! I really wish I didn't have a complaint. It is flavorful and the crust is good.

I ordered using Grubhub, and ordered pizza and a snapple- and while the pizza is great, the snapple was not delivered with it!  I feel jilted out of $3!

Anyways, I guess just be careful when ordering online from them.
author: Haley G.

description:
We ordered via grub hub and the food arrived just in time based on the estimation but the pizza was of only meh, quality and the salad wasn't anything special either.

I could have done better myself on both items we ordered with what I had laying around the apt. However, I am only speaking to the delivery food we obtained as I have never been to the physical store.
author: Brett H.

description:
Came here with my dad the other night. They are pretty new, so I think they are still working out some kinks.

I ordered the gnocchi with marinara sauce. Interestingly, this came with your choice of minestrone soup, or...mashed potatoes? The second option is pretty weird, so I got the soup. Actually, the soup was EXCELLENT and the highlight of my meal. I would absolutely order just that again. The gnocchi was meh, and the sauce was very bland. I would not order a pasta dish again.

My dad had the spaghetti bolognese with meatballs (which were initially forgotten, but apologetically brought separately) and had similar thoughts on the sauce situation.

Despite the pastas being nothing to write home about, they are good-sized portions and you certainly get bang for your buck.

The pizza reviews seem pretty good, though if they use the same sauce, I can't imagine it would be that great. But I won't write it off yet. For now, though, I think I'll just get soup to go.
author: Nora S.

description: I really was unhappy with my delivery order. Came on time. Girlfriend liked her food. I'm. Not picky or snobby about food at all. I'll eat anything. But not the lasagna. It tasted sour. It was really bad. When I called the restaurant about another issue with an item not being delivered I told them about it and that I didn't want a refund. Just letting them know it was possibly spoiled food they served me!!!! The person I spoke with was unimpressed. No apology. Just an "ok, weird. Bye."
author: David W.

description: Love this place. I have eaten in the restaurant as well as having them deliver and they are always great. Pesto canzone for the win.
author: Jamie P.

description:
ordered on grub hub. Food came at the time quoted. Ordered the Greek Goddess. Pizza arrived luke warm, limp and soggy. Pesto barely had any flavor. The sauce makes or breaks the pizza, guys. Maybe they didn't put enough? I dunno. other ingredients tasted fine, I guess. 

Overall, the pizza was MEH. Nothing to get excited about. Feel like I got robbed with a barely warm, limp, pizza. 

I *might* try again if I'm close by  and pick up a hot slice.  
Will never order delivery from them again, if this is the quality to expect.
author: Gloria y.

description:
Very disappointed. Ordered a calzone through GrubHub. Delivery guy showed up late. Apparently the restaurant did not relay my room number accurately. The delivery guy argued at my door about how it was my fault.

Food was mediocre. They didn't follow my instructions and added sauce inside the calzone despite my comments left on GrubHub, this left the calzone soggy. I also ordered a slice of chocolate cake, which was good. Really surprised that I received no utensils or napkins when I ordered from a hotel. Eating the cake was an experience. 

If you're looking for delicious, fresh italian with friendly service, don't choose Bernal Heights Pizzeria.
author: Chris D.

description: Low quality food. We were the only people eating there, and it felt like it had been decorated to be something else inside. It was an uncomfortable experience. The place seems to be empty when we walk by.
author: David H.

description:
GREAT FOOD! GIVE THIS PLACE A TRY! DELIVERY IS FINE, BUT NOTHING BEATS DINNING IN HERE! I've even had my birthday party here. I'm a regular for a reason.

I know I'm going out on a limb here. But if you gonna give a bad review about a place, don't do it out of spite. Especially if they offered to replace your order. I was waiting to make and order, the young woman was being yelled at on the phone. It was loud enough to be heard from the other side of the counter.  I could see her eyes turning red and well up with tears.

If anyone has ever worked in a restaurant or food service, I'm sure you've ran into that one person who seem to just want a reason or excuse to make you feel less than what they are just because your serving them. People that work in resturaunts are human beings and are entitled to human mistakes/errors that can be corrected. Everyone has their "Off" days. There is no reason to be rude about it or spiteful. 

Of coarse if you think the food isn't fit for a Russian prison, go to Russia,  break a law, get locked up, come back, order food from this place, THEN post a review.
author: Marvin B.

description: I give it a 5 because it is good and they have a very thin extra thin crust pizza. Many places have pizza but this menu is great. They deliver, have great hours and good coupons. Not cheap but worth it and fast. Better than most pizzerias in SF. So overall the food is great if you like gourmet super thin crust with delicious bread, the menu is ample if you lazy at home their burgers rock, and their desserts are delicious. So yes 5 stars for the overall product
author: Joseph H.

description:
This is for home delivery.

Service was excellent. It took a number of tries to get through on their phone on a Friday night but it was worth it. 

The girl on the other end of the line was very friendly and courteous. We wanted our pizza cooked extra crispy and she made sure that it was done right. 

Our food was also delivered on time (on a Friday night!) and everything was tasty. Calamari was a generous portion (they forgot the sauce though) and pizza was excellent. It was crispy as promised. Only thing I didn't like was the bruschetta. The bread was enormous slices rather than a small baguette cut up. Other than that they gave us a generous portion of that too. No more dealing with Dominos for me. I'll order from here in the future.
author: Carol A.

description: The pizza here is wonderful... Excellent crust, flavorful sauce, and they do not skimp on toppings. Good service is so hard to find, and the service was friendly and quick. I look forward to coming back.
author: Becca C.

description:
Finding a good pizza place is tough in this city. Finding a great pizza is even tougher. This place falls in to the Great category. The following are the highlights:

1. Pizza slices are cheap.
2. The place is efficient enough for pickup and fancy and clean enough for a date. 
3. The pizza slices are custom made to your liking with about 40 ingredients to chose from.
4. Most places that customize your slices are slow. Thus place was lightning FAST.
5. Slices are Delicious 
6. Beer is cheap.
7. Great wine selection with excellent prices.
8. Service is PHENOMENAL.
9. They have dessert Pizza! Who the hell makes dessert pizza? The taste is spot on!
10. Easy to find parking.
11. The menus have coupons.
12. Wait till you see the spaghetti and meatballs. Emi's spaghetti will lose sleep when they find out about this place.
13. Veggie friendly 
14. Meat eater friendly.
15. They have regular slices and Monster Slices!
16. Did I say the pizza tastes great?
17. All the above all over again...
author: Johnny C.

description:
Bernal Heights Pizzeria is a relatively new spot, and I'm very happy to have it in my neighborhood. The pizza is incredibly tasty and flavorful -- thin crust with good quality cheese and sauce. 
Their delivery is fast and reliable, and everyone I've talked to on the phone is nice. They also have online ordering, which is a huge plus!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
DELICIOUS! i ordered on grub hub and it came 15 minutes early.

loved the pizza. i just got the margarita but it was super fresh and delicious.

this is my new go-to pizza for delivery.
author: danielle m.

description:
I've ordered from this restaurant three times. Each time I ordered the chicken sandwich, and each time the chicken was very burnt tasting. I let them know each time, and the chicken came out the same way every time. Crunchy, burnt, and dry.

It's very hard to find a good sandwich place. I was hoping the four star rating would mean good food. I was wrong.
author: Derekk C.

description:
The pizza here is amazing. Thin crust. 
Our favorite is the Heights Special. 
We usually order a medium, good for two, with enough for lunch the following day. 
We finished it off with their flan.  
Their version is thick and dense, the syrup is dark and bitter sweet. It's very good. 
I want to try their passion fruit mousse next time, if I can tear myself away from the flan...
author: Geordie E.

description: Got the four cheeses pizza, it smelt disgusting, wasn't cooked well and tasted pretty bad. I don't recommend this place
author: Noam S.

description:
Amazingly unique is my best way to describe BHP! Or in three words, delightful, delectable, delicious. This pizza is a sinful delight, WOW. So today my son asked me to order a pizza and to try a new place, boy was he riiiight. Good Lord this pizza is awesome. In a few words, the smell of the bread is like driving by a bread factory, it is heavenly. The taste of the crunchy crust is just perfect. The temperature of the pizza was amazingly hot and the fresh toppings melt in your mouth that one just wants to enjoy every crunch, bite, and then rewind to make the taste last longer. In sum, this place is fit for anyone who wants to enjoy an awesome pizza. I told my son, we are going to say "bye, bye RT" and HELLO, BHP! 

Oh and did I mention their competitive prices? If you are tired of overpaying for a pizza, give BHP a try, you will not regret it.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Had cheese pizza delivery on Saturday.
Pizza was a thin, crispy crust with a good amount of cheese on it. Thinner than NY style, thicker than flatbread style. Notes of basil in the otherwise un-noteworthy sauce. Hardly greasy at all.
Overall, good, not great, and not much to write home about.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Really good pizza. We had a custom pesto, clam and garlic extra thin crust and a regular crust mushroom and anchovy and both were great. Tasty dough and toppings and of course super fresh. 

Minus one star for not having good virgin olive oil and separate balsamic or red wine vinegar for the salad. All the dressing are bottle dressing and what they served in the 70s. We hacked it with lemons and the oil on the table, which revealed the quality of the oil wasn't so great. 

Service is great, but they do a large delivery business so eating in during rush hour might mean waiting for your piZza.
author: Michael W.

description:
Read the reviews and was hopeful. I think I should have tried the pizza. But I had the Chicken Toscana and it arrived as a grey, gloopy, gelatinous, oversalted ick. The veggies were overcooked. And the penne was gluey and undersauced.

Ordered the house salad, and while its big, its just average. And I ordered balsamic and got ranch dressing.

Did I mention I ordered through Eat24 and it took more than 2 hours for my food to arrive? I checked the order once after more than an hour, and the restaurant said it was on its way ... but obviously it wasn't because it took another 45 minutes. Camille was nice wen he arrived, explaining it had to do with the 49er game (which ended 5 hours before my food arrived). They comped me the salad, which was nice, however.

I understand being new in business and having unanticipated challenges. But if you cannot deliver food in the 45-60 minutes you promise on the delivery apps, then let your customers know. I could have made a better choice, appreciated the honesty, and tried again another time.

I'll give it another shot, but I am really irritated with Bernal restaurants making promises they can't keep about delivery.
author: Brooke B.

description:
Ordered from here a few times now.  The pizza has consistently tasted above average....better than most typical chain and mom n pop pizza joints Ive ordered living here in SF.  Its above average food for above average prices.

I had to knock off a star or two because my latest order took almost 2 hours to arrive and they left the chicken out of my chicken alfredo.    But still the pasta ALSO tasted better than other "fettucine alfredo" pastas Ive usually ordered anywhere else.  But hopefully this latest order was an anomaly and I will continue to have good experiences.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Not good at all.  I got sold on one of the door hangers.  General rule, do not trust any of those door hanger menus regardless.  Crust had a strange gas like odor to it.  Pizza sauce was flavorless.  Cheese was kinda funky.  The real kicker was for a large and a small pizza, it came out to 45$ for that price, things should be on the up and up.  Honestly those 1$ frozen totinos pizza would have been 10x better.  Skip this place until they learn to serve better food
author: Pedro N.

description:
For a pizza place,  I give it full marks.  The pizza is surprisingly excellent,  the staff are friendly and responsive,  and the price is out of this world.  $5 for a large slice of pizza and a drink. 

A short distance from Mitchell's ice cream,  this is the best addition to my neighborhood in awhile.
author: Erik C.

description:
Let's make one thing clear: this review is about places that deliver pizza to us in the upper Noe, Diamond Heights, and Glenn Park areas. And, while I hate to say it, there is  a BIG difference between dine-in pizza and delivery (and take-out for that matter): seldom can one find one place that services both or all three needs. The reasons for this anomaly are too innumerable to go into in this post but check with your local New Yorker should you wish to dive into this philosophical topic further. In addition, while there is myriad of topping choices for all pizza options, this review and star rating is specific to the plain cheese and tomato, NY style pizza. Everyone makes one and it is the easiest to compare across multiple places and dining options. I didn't include Domino's, Pizza Hut or other national chain options because my taste buds and conscience wouldn't allow it.

Now that we have set the ground rules for this review, let's get to it. Quite frankly the choices available to us in this small and very under-served delivery area are more limited than most other areas. And, while we have not tried every option, we have had our share of the local choices: NY Pizza to Die For, Haystack, Buffalo (West Portal), and Patxi's pizza just to name a few. While this is not an exhaustive list of choices or places we have tried, what is clear that the current favorite is Bernal Heights Thin Crust NY Style Pizza. (NOTE: this crust option needs to be distinguished from their three sizes: super thin, thin and thick). 

This standard bearing pie is in perfect balance--crust to sauce to cheese to seasonings. The crust is chewy with a certain crispness and is never soggy towards the center (your first sign that you are dealing with amateurs). The sauce is a quality tomato sauce--not too sweet or too much and just the right amount of oregano and other fine Italian spices. The mozzarella cheese is also high quality, reminiscent of a good Brooklyn pizza joint and is not in such an abundant quality to create "cheese coagulitis" (rare condition discovered by Dr. DB when mixing over-cheesy pizza with cold beer). While I can not persoanlly vouch for this, I am told that the toppings should you choose to despoil a perfect pie, are all fresh and high quality. 

Are there better pies in the area? Sure. There are competitive dine-in and take-out options all over this city. And the choices are getting better. For example, PI offers a very good NY style option and you need look no farther than my other reviews to check out brick oven choices that are great and getting better every year (Gialinia, Tony's, Zero Zero, Delfina, etc..) 

Here's what makes Bernal Hts Pizza a great option for delivery. They are by far the tastiest of the local choices, the pie shows up hot every time, the delivery time quoted on the phone is accurate and the other choices available (pastas) are also really good for those relatives that think pizza is uncouth and/or a kid's food. 

While the king of local delivery pizza may change for us, today's winner is Bernal Heights. Take a bow!

NOTE: Amici's could have been a contender except for their arcane delivery map that allows for their pizzas to be delivered to the corner of our street but not down the street to our house. I have tried on multiple occasions to get these guys to realize how much business they are missing out on. Oh well.
author: Peter O.

description:
This is a perfectly average neighbourhood pizza joint.

The pizza isn't much good; the base is foamy and limp, but not inedible, while the top is too cheesy. If you want benchmarks to compare to, we're talking more Dominos here, and less Pizzeria Delfina (ha ha, no, WAY less Delfina).

The service is fine, and the place is clean. Basically, this would be a place I'd return to if I was very drunk or decided I didn't like good food any more. Otherwise, it is to skip.
author: Bryan O.

description: Great pizza.  I always order for delivery.  It seems like they go all the way on the toppings, I never feel skimped.  Good stuff
author: Bobby G.

description: not many pizza places deliver to the bay view and bernal heights is one of them that do. anyways.... the pizza is thin crust pizza the sauce is good most of the time i ahd it a couple times where it was bland but yea when its on point its good lol its not the best but its smooth and they are quick....
author: Rigoberto C.

description: Amazing pizza!!! Perfect crust and great interesting combos. Friendly service-they treat you like family. Do not miss this place!!
author: Kelly M.

description: Went here with high hopes, considering the other reviews. Ordered a small combo pizza and asked for it to be cooked crispy. The crust is super thin, soggy, and not much for taste, and toppings were scarce. Our experience was not a good one and considering that the place was empty, couldn't say they had an off day because they were busy. We ordered a small pizza, salad and two soft drinks and bill was close to $40 bucks. Huge disappointment :(
author: Ronette B.

description: Disappointing. Ordered thru eat24. Delivery was fine but the bruschetta that I ordered was swimming in oil. Had to drain it before serving. Pizza was ok. Second time ordering and sadly I'll move on to somewhere else.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Finally a delivered pizza that is nice and thin, and properly sauced and cheesed! It's delicious!  If you like new york style pizza this is good. No more of the disgusting too thick, and overly cheesed garbage most delivery is in SF.  I ordered a large artichoke heart and capers pizza through grub hub. It showed up early and tastes fantastic. I will be ordering again for sure. I think I found my new go to pizza delivery.
author: Dan S.

description: Just ordered a chicken philly and some nuggets...just threw up 5 timea. Don't think I'm gonna order from here again.
author: Jon S.

description: The pizza was semi warm and the dough wasn't good. Toppings were a bit skimpy too. The "garlic bread" had no garlic but instead was covered in salt. We ended up tossing the entire thing. It's too bad because we really like most small restaurants in Bernal Heights.
author: Vicky L.

description: Wow! After reading the many reviews which were all over the spectrum, I have to say I was pleasantly surprised and my tummy is very happy after ordering online through GrubHub. The delivery arrived in 30 minutes hot and delicious. I ordered the eggplant sandwich on a roll with extra Jack cheese and mushrooms. It was double-wrapped in aluminum foil grilled with the cheeses melting perfectly. I added the lettuce, onions and tomato to make a huge handful of a sandwich. Also, the garlic fries are the thick cut potatoes and tasted better than those at ATT Park (they weren't swimming in olive oil). I'm very happy with my order and my choice.
author: Adrienne K.

description: This place is amazing and owners are incredible people. Their $5 pizza special is almost more than you can eat! Great deal and you can treat a friend! Pizza pizza!
author: Sandra K.

description: We live in the neighborhood and just tried these guys for the first time-- great experience!  Not only was the pizza awesome (Veggie Lovers & SF Supreme = YUM) but I requested the pies be delivered to the playground near our house that can be a bit tricky to find... went off without a hitch!  They were prompt, the ordering was a cinch and the pizza was delicious.  We'll be back!
author: Sara B.

description: We wanted italian, but got food fit for a Russian gulag prison camp. If i could give minus 10 stars, I would. This was theeee worst food I have ever had in my life. No joke !! The reviews are old and/or Bernal is filled with stoners who will eat anything. We had it delivered, but I had to call to have them pick up half of our order because it was terrible.  The pizza was light on toppings and soggy. The fettuccini fruita de mare was missing prawns and baby shrimp, and was dry. There was also a big chunck if fake crab...yuck !! The chicken cacciatore was inedible...dry, tasteless and the chicken was shredded to the point of looking like tuna fish. It was also not cheap, $60 for all this waste of food. Pretty much ruined the night. They should be ashamed. Looks like a four year old was cooking the food. We ended up getting credit on the pasta and chicken dish, but what a hassle. Needless to say we are never ordering from here again.  Bummer
author: Dave S.

description: This pizza was just average. It's a slight step up from frozen but in a city like sf, I'd expect better. If it were a late night and my choices were this or pizza hut, I'd probably order here again but if the competition was open I'd choose the competition next time.
author: Justin D.

description: Great pizza great service and a very chill relaxed environment.. Haven't tried many of the other entrees but the New York steak the salmon and all the pastas are good.. Will defiantly return
author: Chris D.

description: Service was excellent. Pizza was disappointing. The slices are big enough and the deal is pretty sweet, but the pizza itself was just kind of meh. Not bad, not great. We also had the misfortune of coming on a day when they were in the middle of transferring their liquor license so I won't ding them for no beer/wine.
author: Ginna B.

description:
I've ordered from here a few times and the pizza has always been okay. Nothing special, but fine if you just need to get something delivered. But tonight will be the last time I order here. 

I placed the order online and then called to confirm they had the order. They acted like I was an idiot for calling to confirm, but said they had it. An hour and a half later, we called to find out where our pizza was. 

It took no less than 5 phone calls (including being hung up on once) to determine that they could not, in fact, confirm that our order went through. They offered to rush the pizza, but only after those five calls, which took another half an hour. We finally just said forget it and decided to go elsewhere. I'm not sure what's going on over there, but the customer service is really not good.
author: Jessica P.

description: The pizza here is great!  The staff was super super friendly, especially to 3 moms and 3 toddler boys trying to enjoy a nice lunch.  We didn't hear any complaints from the kids who ordered off the kids menu.  And the price is perfect!  They have a $5 lunch special--a pizza slice (which is a huge portion) and drink!  We will definitely be coming back here more often after our playdates at the park!!!
author: Eileen J.

description: Very disappointed. Pizza arrived barely warm and lacked flavor. The meatballs were horrible, they weren't even "meatballs". It was basically ground meat in red sauce. Also, they for for the extra pizza sauce I ordered on the side.
author: Michael M.

description: I was very disappointed in my 4 Cheese Pizza. Along with arriving long after the suggested 45 min time frame I paid for kalmia olives and got none. This is the first pizza I ever threw out in my life.
author: Richard L. D.

description: The pizza here is very good and I'm very pleased with their kids menu. My son LOVED his chicken nuggets and devoured the steamed vegetables. Highly recommend!
author: L P.

description: We ordered a thin crust Margherita and it had a reasonable balance of toppings on a tasty crust.  It's not as cheap as some other delivery places, but the pizza is worth it.  Delivery was quick.
author: Seong P.

description: The food itself was great, swift delivery. Still giving a negative review, as one of their drivers tried to rip us off. Ordered online, paid online. By coincidence, driver meets hubs outside, who didn't know I had already paid. Driver lets hubs pay again (!) - their food is expensive, 2 small, 1 medium pizza for like $70. Hubs asks for receipt, driver first refuses to give it to him (it clearly stated 'settled'!), finally hands it over. Luckily we started talking about the delivery and realized what had happened. Called the Pizzeria, they sent driver back, and we got the money back - with a 'sorry'. Not gonna order there again.
author: Mareen W.

description: This place is an embarrassment to Italian cuisine. The food that we ordered was not good. One item we ordered was the chicken parmesan. First, we requested spaghetti in place of penne. That did not happen and it really should not have been that hard. Second, the chicken was so thick and tough, it needs to be pounded. Third, the entire dish was tasteless. Tasteless breading, cheese, sauce and you can tell the chicken itself was never seasoned before it was breaded. The penne was so over done, it was gross and steamed vegetables on the side? Come on, what is this 1984? This meal was way too expensive for what it was. On top of that all, I went to the website to submit these comments instead of posting to yelp, and their contact web form does not work. Lastly, logging into Yelp and seeing their alert that this place's recent health inspection score was in the bottom 5% and was "poor" has convinced me that we will not be returning soon. Sorry Bernal Heights Pizzeria, we are done.
author: Meg M.

description: I was passing through the neighborhood and came across this place. Their pizza was delicious! They had a nice selection of salads, pastas and pizzas. The restaurant was impeccably clean and had very reasonably priced entrées. I highly recommend checking them out.
author: Maria M.

description: It was OK, but if it were my last night on earth and I were craving pizza for dinner, Bernal Heights Pizzeria would be the last place I'd have on speed dial. The crust is OK, a little bread-y for my taste, but nonetheless OK. The toppings are another story. We ordered a cheese pizza and built our own combo with six toppings. For a large pizza, they charge $1.75 per topping. Fair enough. The problem was that the toppings were too few and far between with huge empty spots on each slice. Only three pieces had broccoli on them for a total of six miniscule (and I mean miniscule) florets, and the other toppings were really stingy as well. I'm not one to quibble over price, but seriously, whatever amount they decide to charge for a topping, there should be enough of it to be noticeable. We won't be ordering from them again.
author: E. G.

description: Really great customer service. Our waitress was extremely attentive and was very cheerful. I would definitely recommend this pizzeria to friends and family! The pizza was delicious and if I lived closer, I would be going there more often.
author: Amanda H.

description: I was hung up on 7 times before I was done speaking. I was not treated nicely I was through off like I meant nothing. I was very upset that each time I called I was abrupted and was hung up on. Then the person o the phone had the audacity to tell me to take my burdens other were. I will never order from here or tell friends or family to order from this place because of the terrible service.
author: Frick C.

description: The Popeyes spinach salad is 4 stars!!! Delish and fresh!! Yum yum yum!!! Three stars for the pizza but it also had very fresh ingredients as well and great to satisfy your pizza craving. The place is very clean and the server was attentive to our needs.
author: Priscilla E.

description: This is a great pizzeria especially for delivery! I believe they are brand new also. I've tried practically all the pizza places in bernal heights and this place has to be my favorite. The ingredients are high quality and fresh. Can't got wrong with a meat lovers pizza. They came in clutch when I was hungry for dinner. Was thinking of dominos but this place beats dominos hands down. Fast delivery also
author: Dan G.

description: Horrible service and sub-par pizza. I ordered a delivery and it arrived an 1 hour and 1/2 later, the pizza was cold and soggy. I called to complain and the manager, a very rude woman was unapologetic. It is not like there aren't 3000 other pizza place in San Francisco. I will never order from this place ever again...
author: Omar C.

description: Good pizza; not the best pizza I've had by any stretch. I had a salami, sun dried tomato, and Feta Cheese pizza. The crust was a bit soft and could've benefited from being left in the oven a bit longer to give it a crispier texture.  The service was great ( Camille was awesome over the phone!) and the experience overall was a good  experience.
author: Edwin S.

description:
My new go-to delivery pizza pie spot! 
I really liked the dough, sauce, and topping ratio as did the four friends I shared pies with a few days ago. 
We had the basic cheese, Toscana, and an egglplant w/ ricotta. All good however, the Toscana was the stand-out. Lots of flavor! Different. 
Good sized slices - everything tasted fresh - not out of a can. All around yum. 
People have indicated that this place is spendier than others - I was Ok with the prices - it's much better pie than most of the other delivery spots. 
Bernal Heights Pizzeria has made my speed dial ---
author: Carson R.

description: Yeah! Got delivery -- I live in the central mission. It was still hot when it got here. This pizza was picture perfect. Super tasty. No disappointments.
author: Melville M.

description: Very good pizza. The crust is perfect - thin and crispy. We had the Greek Goddess, which I recommend if you like olives. Its a bit long the get the pizza, takes about 20 minutes to prepare. The place could be a bit better decorated, its not very welcoming, and definitely not the right place for a romantic dinner. Take it to go or delivery.
author: Patrick D.

description: Not the best pizza in the world, but tasted good and for 2 slices and a soda it was only $6.50. That price plus less than half a block away from my house makes for a happy girl. If you're looking for great pizza, however, try somewhere else.
author: Alexandra W.

description: I'm a snobby NY pizza lover. I'm from there. It's in my blood. I'm picky about my pies. This shop knows what it's doing. And it's consistent. Which is everything, really. Add amazing service and convenience to my house and I'm almost in the Lower East Side if shut my eyes. Highly recommend.
author: Ben W.

description: The pizza is fantastic and I can't even describe how amazing, friendly, and welcoming the owners and staff are. This place is an amazing addition to my neighborhood. I will continue to support this new business.
author: Michael D.

description: Friendly family run restaurant, with generous portions and smiling staff eager to please and make the experience exceptional. A nice addition to the neighborhood. We'll be back
author: Haywood J.

description: Thin crust, delicious, exactly what a pizza should be. Early monday morning delivery!
author: Sonja L.

description:
It seems that it is really hard to please everybody! I read a bad review and another not so good, but most of them are very good, so it looks like the data gives evidence that the good reviews are more reliable, and I am here to add my opinion.
The place is very clean, the helpers are courteous, and the owners strive for good quality overall. I am not the easiest person to please either, but I loved their food. The comments about the pizza are intriguing since I find theirs the best I ever had in San Francisco and the Bay Area. 
Good, very good food. Good service, clean place; in sum a very pleasant environment!
author: Silvia A.

description:
As with others who are not originally from SF, we have struggled to find a good pizza.  We've found many of the local options to have an usually thick bubbly crust or really uninspiring sauce.  Bernal Heights Pizzeria finally gets it.  

We had guests over and decided to order plain cheese, pepperoni and the SF Special.  All were good and have that perfect blend of sauce, cheese and ingredients.  The crust was just the right thickness and not overly doughy.   We didn't try the pastas, sides or salads other than cheese sticks, which were good.

The staff was great and very nice on the phone. Next time, we are going to try eating in.
author: Suzanne P.

description: Maybe my mistake was NOT ordering the pizza because as I take time to look at the reviews the good ones talk about the pizza.  I ordered the seafood pasta and to say I was disappointed would be an under statement. Apparently the cooks do not know their own menu as the dish said nothing about having crab in it let alone IMMITATION crab and said there were prawns but I did not find one!!!  We also ordered the chicken cacciatore the flavor was okay but the chicken was dry and overcooked.  When we tried to cut a piece of chicken with a heavy duty Dixie plasitc knife (not the cheap stuff they sent with the maeals) the knofe actually snapped.  If you are goign to eat here and want to enjoy your meal then only eat the pizza!
author: Angel L.

description: mmmm....still good u guyz...got my pizza wing thing, but the wings were soggy this time., oh well...guess ill chase the soggys away with a shot of bulliet. ...thanks b heights pizza...always good!
author: Todd W.

description: Ordered a Pizza Margherita, dough was flat, no flavor, pizza was missing salt (seasoning).  Requested WELL DONE! Crispy bottom, they could not even accomplish that simple task.
author: Altaeb s.

description: Pizza tasted like it was frozen before they heated it. Slightly mushy crust. Also didn't seem to have slices ready to go (ever) so it took a while. At least they had a friendly cashier.
author: Munaf A.

description: I ordered 3 Pizza's f for a company function and they were horrible.  They tasted stale and lacked any flavor what so ever.  I ordered a veggie lover, meat lover, and cheese pizza, nothing difficult or out of the ordinary.  When I opened the boxes to see what my $85 had bought me I was severely disappointed and embarrassed.  The pizza at Costco is far better than the dried out, stale, sparsely topped pie looking back at me.  I will never give this restaurant my business ever again.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Ordered delivery here twice. First time was mediocre. Second time was by far some of the worst pizza I've ever had. Seriously dominos is better. We didn't even eat the leftovers. The pizza was soggy, thin and droopy. There was no flavor and it had a bitter almost rotten aftertaste. I would not recommend this place and will not be ordering from here again. Disgusting.
author: Ms. G.

description: Great customer service Cute little waitress nice cozy atmosphere as well and very good pizza & Italian food  in Bernal heights will be back soon :)
author: John D.

description: Not gourmet,  but good!  Good crust,  friendly folks, good price,  let me bring in my bottle of wine in since they were still waiting on their license. Great folks, good neighborhood pizza... giv'em a shot.
author: Bartholomew H.

description: This is a review for delivery only. I have never been inside the restaurant, although I drove by it the other day and noticed its location for the first time. I order from this place way too much, because the quality is just great and beats any other pizza place that delivers to Glen Park. Their pizzas are thin crust and have just the right amount of grease and flavor. They are surprisingly good quality for a place that delivers and the Chicken Bacon Ranch pizza is to die for (Although, your stomach probably won't be happy with you the next morning). I have had a bunch of different pizzas that they serve and I haven't been disappointed once. Their delivery is always quick and never later than the time they quote, which is great. For delivery in Glen Park/Diamond Heights, it doesn't get better than Bernal Heights Pizzaria (and yes, I have literally tried every pizza place on grubhub that delivers here. Sadly). Pricewise, they are a little more expensive than most other places, but what's literally a few dollars when the quality if light years above other pizzerias?
author: Max M.

description: Very good pizza and fast delivery. Online ordering as well. This will be my new pizza delivery spot!
author: Lara R.

description: Our friend Marvin introduced us to this pizzeria at his birthday party! The hosts were lovely and the food was really tasty. He did a take out order for me and my fellow co-workers a few days ago and the pizza was as good as I remembered it. :)
author: Chibi S.

description: We like this place for the convenience and ease of bringing our kids. The mac and cheese is my son's favorite and the pizza is decent.  I would recommend a couple more chairs for toddlers. We will be back.
author: Patrick M.

description: We love this place. We order through Eat24 and the order usually arrives early. Great pizza and salads. And it's a nice place to go in person, with friendly and efficient service. Cheerful, nice delivery guys. And, oh yes, the pizza--really, really good. If I don't finish this review I'll place another order.
author: Russ W.
